summary: This is a brief email exchange between Michael A. Osborn of the FBI and an unnamed individual from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, arranging a status call regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Michael A. Osborn
persons.context: FBI agent from New York office initiating a request for a status call on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Ted
persons.context: Recipient of the email from FBI agent Michael Osborn, arranging a call to discuss the Epstein case.

connections.description: FBI agent and U.S. Attorney's Office representative coordinating a status call regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduling of Epstein status call
events.description: FBI agent Michael Osborn and U.S. Attorney's Office representative Ted arrange a phone call to discuss the status of the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The email exchange shows ongoing coordination between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein investigation in December 2019.
The communication is brief and logistical, focused on scheduling a status update call.
The document references the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, which was handling the Epstein prosecution.
